Topic.Title: Qualcomm quad-core tablet arrives - for deep pockets

Message.Msg: - Well, nvidia charges $629.00 for their Tegra 3 Development Kit. But it only comes with that Cuda Toolkit that nobody really wants. So you need to buy OpenCL seperately. And there's apparently no baseband radio of any kind. None. So the Tegra 3 Development Kit is a stripped-down no-frills kind of kit. Take a look. http://www.seco.com/carmakit So if you want the best, buy the Qualcomm Development Kit. It's got ALL the pieces parts inside. -

Topic.Title: Industrial Light and Magic claims game graphics will match reality in 10 years

Message.Msg: I don't think he "knows" what can and cannot be done in hardware in the next 10 years, certainly not to the extent that NVDA and ATI do, where they are always striving to improve. I know GPU architects who say there are decades (plural) of work ahead. Quite a bold statement if you ask me.
